alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 4:08PM MST until March 15 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Wet Beaver Creek downstream to the confluence of the Verde River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 404 PM MST, gauge reports indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Rapid snowmelt is also occurring and will add to the flooding. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Beaver Creek and Rarick Canyon. Flooding is occurring along the Wet Beaver Creek. The current river stage is 9.3 feet. The flood crest of 13.4 feet is expected to reach the Wet Beaver Creek stream gage upstream of Rimrock between 1:00 to 2:00 AM Thu. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camp Verde, Rimrock, Montezuma Well, Lake Montezuma, Mcguireville, Montezuma Castle National Monument, Wet Beaver Creek Campground and V Bar V Visitors Center. - This includes the following swimming holes... Wet Beaver Creek Day Use Area and Bell Crossing "The Crack". This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 290 and 299. State Route 179 near mile marker 299. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event.
